hotcat

  • settings module

settings module¶

This module contains global settings for all modules.

PYTHON_PATH = ''¶

the path to your python executable. empty string for default system interpreter.

MODULE_LIST = ['server.queue_manager', 'server.web', 'worker.input_worker', 'worker.result_worker', 'worker.sslyze_worker', 'helper.status']¶

all modules in this list will be started in separate process.

LOG_MODULES = ['server.queue_manager', 'server.web', 'worker.input_worker', 'worker.result_worker', 'worker.sslyze_worker', 'helper.status']¶

the output of the modules in this list will be logged to console or to file.

LOG_FILE = None¶

the file in which all output will be written. If None it goes to stdout.

WEB_SERVER_ADDRESS = 'localhost'¶

the bind address of the web server.

WEB_SERVER_PORT = 50002¶

the bind port of the web server.

SERVER_ADDRESS = 'localhost'¶

the bind address of the QueueServer.

SERVER_PORT = 50001¶

the bind port of the QueueServer.

SERVER_AUTH = 'abc'¶

the authentication string of the QueueServer.

NUMBER_PROCESSES = 2¶

the number of sslyze worker processes

COMMAND_LIST = ['tlsv1_2', 'tlsv1_1', 'tlsv1', 'sslv3', 'sslv2', 'certinfo']¶
a list of commands that sslyze will be used for scanning.
available commands are:
[“tlsv1_2”, “tlsv1_1”, “tlsv1”, “sslv3”, “sslv2”, “reneg”, “hsts”, “resum”, “resum_rate”, “heartbleed”, “chrome_sha1”, “compression”, “certinfo”]

For details see SSLyze.

SHARED_SETTINGS = {'ca_file': None, 'certinfo': 'basic', 'starttls': None, 'resum': True, 'resum_rate': None, 'http_get': True, 'xml_file': None, 'compression': True, 'tlsv1': True, 'targets_in': None, 'keyform': 1, 'https_tunnel': None, 'chrome_sha1': None, 'sslv3': True, 'sslv2': True, 'hsts': None, 'nb_retries': 4, 'heartbleed': True, 'sni': None, 'https_tunnel_host': None, 'regular': False, 'key': None, 'reneg': True, 'tlsv1_2': True, 'tlsv1_1': True, 'hide_rejected_ciphers': True, 'quiet': None, 'keypass': '', 'cert': None, 'timeout': 5, 'xmpp_to': None}¶
this are shared settings used by sslyze.
For details see SSLyze.
